physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Presentation of Cushingâ€™s syndrome with limited facial changes and secondary amenorrhea; elevated urinary and serum cortisol; elevated dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate; elevated total testosterone.
Total testosterone declined from 6.14 to 0.32 nmol/liter (normal <3.7 nmol/liter); immediate postoperative CT and bone scans were negative for metastases.
Reported pain in right flank area; abdominal CT showed a low-attenuating lesion measuring 2.2 cm in the tumor bed.
Underwent open right radical nephrectomy; pathology confirmed metastatic adrenocortical carcinoma.
CT scan revealed new disease in the liver and pulmonary metastases.
Reduction in size of liver metastases from 4.4 to 2.6 cm; right adrenal bed remained stable.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The size of liver metastases reduced; no evidence of new lesions in the right adrenal bed.
